{include "default_salutation"} –

During this Legislative Session, the ACLU of Georgia fought to pass good bills that advanced civil rights and liberties and stop harmful bills from becoming law.

These are a small recap of the legislative issues we’ve worked on this session. However, our website includes more details. In partnership with coalition partner organizations, we:

  • Expanded access to postpartum care.
  • Passed a law to expunge criminal records and took an additional step towards fighting the criminalization of poverty.
  • Fought hard against anti-criminal justice reform and anti-racial equality legislation.

Additionally, in its haste to silence Georgians’ demand for police accountability, the Georgia Legislature passed HB838. This extremely flawed bill could harm the free speech rights of those who are victims of police misconduct. For instance, HB838 could permit police officers to file a lawsuit against an individual who merely files a complaint on something as simple as alleging police misconduct. The bill passed and now sits on the governor’s desk for his signature.

Call Governor Kemp at 404-656-1776 and ask him to VETO HB 838. Note: this link will open the call app from your phone.

Make A Call

While this legislative session has ended, the ACLU of Georgia’s work is far from done. We continue to work diligently to stop dangerous bills that threaten progress in our state, and we are fighting to ensure that your civil liberties are protected.

Thank you for all the work you do in the wake of such a historic time and for being loyal defenders of civil liberties.

Christopher Bruce, Esq.
Political Director, ACLU of {affiliate_name}
